1438891511689666560.text:
The expanded Child Tax Credit is a step towards reducing poverty. 

Today we spoke with families about the effects of poverty and how the credit eased that burden. 

We are hard at work to make the Child Tax Credit permanent — because poverty won't end when the pandemic does. https://t.co/jetkVpS2Gz

1438866599864381444.text: "I am committed to making this permanent. We will take half of the children of New York out of poverty. 19% of kids in Yonkers are in poverty. That's too high, and it hurts all of us." — @SenSchumer

1438863642376691712.text: @USTreasury "Poverty goes beyond food. It goes beyond race. It goes beyond housing. I hope that all the elected officials do the right thing, we need permanent solutions." — Diana Sanchez, Yonkers

1438862044112039939.text: "When I received checks for my kids from @USTreasury, I breathed a sigh of relief for what that meant for me. The passage of the Child Tax Credit has meant that my children are housed, in school, and fed." — Norberta Guerrero, Yonkers

1438860735602376710.text: "When you're in poverty, it feels like the whole world is closing in on you. This Child Tax Credit has given my daughter the opportunity to see she can do everything he friends can do." — Raquel Ali

1438859624170536961.text: "These are very hard times. But we're here to help you. It's our jobs. We represent you, our job is to meet your needs. This Child Tax Credit is the right answer — it's direct cash right into your hands, because you know how to spend it best for your families." — @SenGillibrand

1438858118843314177.text: "Before the American Rescue Plan, half of Black and Latinx families were eligible for the child tax credit. Now, they are all eligible. You are eligible for this money that will help you pay your bills and help you take care of your children." — @TreasuryDepSec

1438856373555671042.text: "Working in education for 20 years, you see the impact of poverty every single day. Poverty intersects with every aspect of our lives." — @RepBowman

1438855360824160260.text: @SenSchumer @SenGillibrand @TreasuryDepSec "Here in Westchester, 1 in 5 people have food insecurity. So you know this tax credit matters." — @AndreaSCousins

1438853973180567561.text:

1430947388873748488.text: As we work with the Biden administration and other members of local, state and federal government on the immediate safety of constituents, we will continue our advocacy for increasing the number of refugees allowed into the United States.

1425521306812956672.text: This resolution will name August 11th, 2021 as Hip Hop Celebration Day, August 2021 as Hip Hop Recognition Month, and November 2021 as Hip Hop History Month.

1369748697593110528.text: An immediate next priority for Congress and the White House must be a nationwide $15 minimum wage. The Biden administration was given a mandate by voters to secure a $15 minimum. They must deliver.

1369748696456388615.text: The #AmericanRescuePlan provides $1,400 payments to many who are in need. But families should never be without our support. That means we’ll keep pushing for $2,000 recurring checks for the duration of the pandemic, and a strengthened social safety net thereafter.

1369748695370133506.text: Our kids and families have dealt with unbelievable trauma during this pandemic, and I’m optimistic that this package will help us to heal. But there are many ways we can still go even further.

1369748694455750662.text: Importantly, the rescue plan drastically reduces poverty, particularly among people of color, and provides $170 billion in resources for education to assist with a smooth and safe reopening of in-person learning across the country.

1369748693491023875.text: The #AmericanRescuePlan, although not perfect, is a significant and profound step to rebuild what we've lost during this pandemic, move toward making families whole, and save lives.
